Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for ~3 months. No bowel movement for 2-3 days, then difficult and painful passage. Associated abdominal cramps, bloating, and a swollen stomach. Pain on abdominal pressure. No blood in stool, no recent weight loss, no change in urination. Long-standing poor appetite and underweight status. Tried olive oil at home which helped soften stool. Family hx of sister with ulcerative colitis, but patient has different symptoms. Social: Eats very little. Request: Wants to know if condition is serious and how to soften stools; also interested in seeing a dietician for being underweight.
Objective: Abdomen: Appears bloated/rounder. Auscultation: Normal bowel sounds. Percussion: Varying tympani, some dampening in Left Lower Quadrant. Palpation: Sensitive in Left Lower Quadrant. Non-tender in upper abdomen and Right Lower Quadrant. No pain at renal lodges.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome, constipation-predominant (IBS-C). No alarm symptoms noted.
Plan:
1. Prescribe Psyllium fibre sachets to be taken daily with plenty of water. 
2. Continue for 6 weeks then re-evaluate. 
3. Safety Netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool. 
4. Follow-up: Appointment in 6 weeks to evaluate results. Will discuss dietician referral at that time.
